detaileddescription.para: nfs4_op_getattr_pseudo: Gets attributes for directory in pseudo fs
Gets attributes for directory in pseudo fs. These are hardcoded constants.

parameterdescription.para: [INOUT] Pointer to the compound request's data

detaileddescription.para: nfs4_op_access_pseudo: Checks for object accessibility in pseudo fs.
Checks for object accessibility in pseudo fs. All entries in pseudo fs return can't be accessed as ACCESS4_MODIFY|ACCESS4_EXTEND|ACCESS4_DELETE because pseudo fs is behaving as a read-only fs.

parameterdescription.para: [INOUT] Pointer to the compound request's data

detaileddescription.para: nfs4_op_lookup_pseudo: looks up into the pseudo fs.
looks up into the pseudo fs. If a junction traversal is detected, does the necessary stuff for correcting traverse.

parameterdescription.para: [INOUT] Pointer to the compound request's data

simplesect.para: NFS4_OK if successfull, other values show an error.

detaileddescription.para: nfs4_op_lookupp_pseudo: looks up into the pseudo fs for the parent directory
looks up into the pseudo fs for the parent directory of the current file handle.

parameterdescription.para: [INOUT] Pointer to the compound request's data

simplesect.para: NFS4_OK if successfull, other values show an error.

detaileddescription.para: nfs4_op_readdir_pseudo: Reads a directory in the pseudo fs
Reads a directory in the pseudo fs.

parameterdescription.para: [INOUT] Pointer to the compound request's data

simplesect.para: NFS4_OK if successfull, other values show an error.

detaileddescription.para: nfs4_PseudoToId: TConverts a file handle (to a pseudo object) to the id of this pseudo object in the pseudofs

This routine merely extracts a field from the file handle which is not seen as opaque in this case. Because file handle are opaque structure, it is prefered to have a dedicated function for this and so hiding the file handle internal structure.

parameterdescription.para: [IN] pointer to the file handle to process.

detaileddescription.para: nfs4_GetPseudoFs: Gets the root of the pseudo file system.
Gets the root of the pseudo file system. This is only a wrapper to static variable gPseudoFs.
nfs4_ExportToPseudoFS: Build a pseudo fs from an exportlist
Build a pseudo fs from an exportlist. This export list itself is obtained by reading the configuration file.
nfs4_PseudoToFattr: Gets the attributes for an entry in the pseudofs

Gets the attributes for an entry in the pseudofs. Because pseudo fs structure is very simple (it is read-only and contains only directory that belongs to root), a set of standardized values is returned

parameterdescription.para: [IN] pointer to the pseudo fs entry on which attributes are queried
[OUT] Pointer to the buffer that will contain the queried attributes
[INOUT] Pointer to the compound request's data
[IN] Pointer to a bitmap that describes the attributes to be returned

simplesect.para: 0 if successfull, -1 if something wrong occured. In this case, the reason is that too many attributes were asked.

xrefdescription.para: : BUGAZOMEU: Allocation at NULL Adress here....
: not the right answer, actual quotas should be implemented
: not the right answer, actual quotas should be implemented
: BUGAZOMEU: Allocation at NULL Adress here....
: BUGAZOMEU: Allocation at NULL Adress here....

detaileddescription.para: nfs4_FhandleToPseudo: converts a NFSv4 file handle fs to an id in the pseudo
Converts a NFSv4 file handle fs to an id in the pseudo, and check if the fh is related to a pseudo entry

simplesect.para: TRUE if successfull, FALSE if an error occured (this means the fh4 was not related to a pseudo entry)

detaileddescription.para: nfs4_PseudoToFhandle: converts an id in the pseudo fs to a NFSv4 file handle
Converts an id in the pseudo fs to a NFSv4 file handle.

simplesect.para: NFS4_OK if successfull, other values show an error.

detaileddescription.para: nfs4_CreateROOTFH: Creates the file handle for the "/" of the pseudo file system
Creates the file handle for the "/" of the pseudo file syste.

parameterdescription.para: [OUT] pointer to the file handle to be allocated
[INOUT] pointer to the compound request's data

simplesect.para: NFS4_OK if successfull, NFS4ERR_BADHANDLE if an error occured when creating the file handle.

briefdescription.para: Routines used for managing the NFS4 pseudo file system.

detaileddescription.para:
Author
leibovic
Date
2006/02/08 12:49:32
Revision
1.24
nfs4_pseudo.c: Routines used for managing the NFS4 pseudo file system.
